data.author: Michael Jeronimo
data.message:
Use timeouts in service calls to avoid hangs (#98)

* Use async service calls to avoid hangs

Don't assume that all ROS nodes support the parameter services. Instead
explicitly look for the ListParameters service.

Also, don't assume that all nodes are spinning. Instead of using synchronous
service calls (which will hang if the node is not spinning to process its
messages) using an async call with a timeout.

Fixes #97, fixes #96, fixes #64

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

* Use leading underscore on private function

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

* Remove the sleep in the constructor and handle auto-refresh in a different PR

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

* Cancel the future in case of timeout

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

* Use rclpy.spin_until_future complete

Simpler code than the previous version which was based roughly off
of the code for client.call().

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

* Address some code review feedback

Signed-off-by: Michael Jeronimo <michael.jeronimo@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Michael Jeronimo
data.message: Add maintainer to package.xml (#95)

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Save instance state in rqt settings (#79) (#90)

New settings being saved:
- Current node list filter
- Currently expanded items in the node list
- Currently active editors (order preserved)

To reconcile the existing behavior for opening nodes from the command
line with the restoration of previously open nodes, I opted to treat the
nodes on the command line as an explicit list rather than an additive
one. So the command line list effectively 'overrides' the previous
state.

Forward-port of 672cc674248674c20ccab8990c2bb102e6376ce3

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Use safe YAML loader (#89)

This change was made in `master` as part of
2dde2e391ed4d29f0bffd2b10fdee6a33375a456. Unlike in ROS 1, the config
structure doesn't need a custom YAML constructor to be loaded with the
default YAML safe loader.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Don't process scroll events unless specifically focused (#88)

It can be really easy to accidentally change these values while
scrolling along in the editor. This change makes it necessary to focus
(clicking on, tabbing to, etc) a widget before the scroll wheel can
change it.

Forward-port of 305e82a5f21024507ea17562ac8acda2f6cf4726

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Fix node selection from command line (#87)

This was sort-of working, but the tree of node names on the left side
got messed up when you tried to deselect a node. It was completely
ineffective for nodes in namespaces.

Turns out we were getting lucky that it worked at all, because the code
relied on storing a Qt index object that wasn't supposed to be
persistent. So when the tree got more complex, it completely fell apart.

I updated the code to just iterate over all of the items in the tree to
find the node we want. We'll only have to do this once, and only if the
user is specifying what nodes to open from the command line.

Forward-port of 9d256c40603ea8a9508d44bc1b2d797ac354bd64

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
rqt_reconfigure: Add ability to open clients from command line

This allows a user to list the names of dynamic reconfigure servers they wish
to connect to on startup. Unlike the original implementation in
reconfigure_gui, this makes rqt_reconfigure accept any number of clients, not
just one.

The servers can also be referenced using relative paths from the namespace
where rqt_reconfigure is started.

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
rqt_reconfigure: Cache received param changes

rqt_reconfigure: Unify update value naming

Currently, the 'old value' is cached when we send changes (so we don't send an unnecessary update). When the value is changed externally, however, we should update the 'old value' to prevent unnecessary updates here, too.

data.message:
Merge pull request #209 from cottsay/rqt_reconfigure-editor-rewrite

rqt_reconfigure: Re-write widget data flow

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
rqt_reconfigure: Re-write widget data flow

rqt_reconfigure is virtually unusable as is, and sends duplicate and unnecessary updates to the server frequently. This patch updates the PyQt widgets' structure to address many of the issues reported with rqt_reconfigure.

data.message:
rqt_reconfigure) Remove illegal test depend (thanks @po1).

python's module unittest shouldn't be referred in package.xml. And no need for it to be defined in rosdep either since it's a part of python's standard (I'm not sure 100% about this though).
